Ameriprise Financial, Inc. is a long-standing leader in financial planning and advice offering a broad range of products and services designed to assist individual and institutional clients achieve their financial objectives . We are in a compelling position to capitalize on significant demographic and market trends driving increased demand for financial advice and solutions . Our primary target market is households with $500,000 to $5,000,000 in investable assets .
 Our network of more than 10,000 financial advisors is the primary channel through which we carry out our wealth management activities . Through our affiliated advisors, we offer financial planning and advice, cash management and banking products, and full-service brokerage services, primarily to retail clients . Our capabilities are centered on establishing long-term personal relationships between clients and advisors .
 Investment products are primarily offered through third parties, though we also provide our asset management products through our advisor network, direct retail and through our institutional sales force . We have expanded beyond our traditional strengths in the U.S. and the United Kingdom to serve more clients and gather assets worldwide . We continue to pursue opportunities to leverage the collective capabilities of our global asset management business in order to enhance our investment solutions .
 Ameriprise Financial has grown organically through the products and services we provide, as well as inorganically through strategic acquisitions . In 2005, AEFC spun off from American Express to form Ameriprises Financial, Inc. In May 2019, we have also sought to optimize the organizational structure in which we offer certain banking products .
 As of December 31, 2024, Ameriprise Financial, Inc. had $1.5 trillion in assets under management, administration, and advisement . The company's integrated model leverages key business linkages to drive growth and consistency across market cycles . The following chart shows the contributions of each segment to our pretax adjusted operating earnings (excluding Corporate & Other segment) as well as a historical comparison .
 The foreign operations of Ameriprise Financial, Inc. are conducted primarily through Columbia Threadneedle Investments UK International Limited and TAM UK International Holdings Limited . The company uses the RiverSource brand for its annuity and protection products issued by RiverSource Life Insurance Company (“RiverSource Life”) and RiverSource Insurance Co. of New York .
 With more than 10,000 advisors, Ameriprise is one of the top branded advisor platforms in the U.S. market . Advisors can choose to affiliate with us in multiple ways as noted below . Each option offers different levels of support and compensation . We also earn revenue and income through other sources .
 We provide investment management, advice and products to retail, high net worth and institutional clients on a global scale . As of December 31, 2024, our Asset Management segment had $681 billion in managed and advised assets . We receive a portion of the revenue generated from the sale of unaffiliated products and certain administrative fees .
 Penses for this segment include distribution expenses for services provided by Advice & Wealth Management and Retirement & Protection Solutions segments . All intersegment activity is eliminated in our consolidated results . Managed external client assets include client assets for which we provide investment management services, such as the assets of the Columbia Threadneedle Investments .
 Ameriprise Financial, Inc. has $645 billion in assets under management . It has a presence in 16 key markets globally, including France, Germany, Luxembourg, the Netherlands, Singapore, the U.K. and U.S. The company has a range of investment strategies across these different vehicles and accounts . The company's investment management capabilities and products span a broad range of asset classes .
 The firm earned management and performance-related fees for a range of clients, including pension, profit-sharing, employee savings, sovereign wealth funds and endowment funds . The firm earns fees based on the value of the assets and the performance-based fees associated with the assets under advisement . It also earned management fees for the accounts of large- and medium-sized businesses and governmental clients .
 RiverSource seeks to partner with our advisors to address clients’ goals and long-term needs at a differentiated level and provide a strong risk profile . We offer clients annuities, life insurance and disability income insurance products to meet their needs or current stage in life—whether that is covering essentials, ensuring lifestyle, preparing for the unexpected or leaving a legacy .
 The primary sources of revenues for our protection business are premiums, fees, and charges we receive to assume insurance-related risk . We earn net investment income on owned assets supporting insurance reserves and on capital support . New  RiverSource insurance products are exclusively offered through our advisor network . All intersegment activity is eliminated in our consolidated results .
 The protection products earn intersegment revenues from fees paid by our Asset Management segment for marketing support and other services provided in connection with the availability of VIT Funds under the variable universal life contracts . We also receive fees based on the level of the RiverSource Life companies’ separate account assets supporting variable Universal life investment options .
 We reinsure a portion of the insurance risks associated with our currently offered life and disability income products through reinsurance agreements with unaffiliated reinsurance companies . We use reinsurance to limit losses, reduce exposure to large risks and provide additional capacity for continued product offerings . Our RiverSource Life companies remain primarily liable as the direct insurers on all risks reinsured .
 RiverSource Life discontinued offering LTC insurance as of December 31, 2002 . A large majority of our closed block LTC is comprised of nursing home indemnity LTC or comprehensive reimbursement LTC . Premium rates for LTC policies vary by age, benefit period, elimination  of closed blocks of business and net investment income or loss on corporate level assets .
 Premium rates are based on assumptions concerning morbidity, mortality, persistency, administrative expenses, investment income and profit . RiverSource Life has continued ceding 50% of the risk on a coinsurance basis to subsidiaries of Genworth Financial, Inc. (“Genworth”) for existing LTC policies .
 As of December 31, 2024, we have $5.7 billion of account value associated with our fixed annuities of which 89% has been ceded by RiverSource Life on a coinsurance basis to Global Atlantic Financial Group’s subsidiary Commonwealth Annuity and Life Insurance Company (Commonwealth) For the ceded policies,  RiverSource Life ceded 100% of the risk .
 Our Asset Management segment competes on a global basis against a substantial number of firms to acquire and retain managed and administered assets . Competitive factors influencing our performance in this industry include investment performance, product offerings and innovation, product ratings, fee structures, advertising, technology and service quality . The impact of these factors on our business may vary from country to country and certain competitors may have competitive advantage in certain jurisdictions .
 Ameriprise Financial has a strong values-driven and inclusive culture that is the foundation of all that we do . We are committed to providing an excellent employee and advisor experience for our global workforce . We work closely with leaders to prioritize organizational stewardship, leadership excellence and operating effectiveness . We continually invest in our human capital programs to ensure a highly competitive employee value proposition .
 Our total rewards programs are designed to attract, retain, and motivate employees . Weighing both individual goal achievement (the “what” and leadership performance is critical to driving strong business results . We have a competitive total compensation approach that includes base salary, annual cash awards and long-term incentives, as well as a comprehensive benefits strategy .
 Inclusion Index from our employee engagement survey, we achieved a score of 84% in 2024, which exceeds the industry benchmark . Our global workforce is comprised of 40% women and, among our U.S. based employees, 22% are ethnically diverse . In addition to recruiting talented professionals to join Ameriprise, we retained 95% of our high-performing employees .
 Our 13 global business resource networks, with over 23,000 employee engagements, are open to everyone and provide opportunities for connection, community and career development . We rely on a combination of contractual rights and copyright, trademark, and patent registrations and trade secret laws to establish and protect our intellectual property . We have established and registered, or filed applications to register, certain trademarks and service marks that we consider important to the marketing of our products and services .
 All aspects of our business, including the activities of our parent company and subsidiaries, are subject to various federal, state, local and foreign laws and regulations . The consequences for failing to comply may include civil or criminal charges, fines, censure, the suspension of individual employees . We expect the current U.S. administration will seek to implement a regulatory reform .
 We continue to see enhanced legislative and regulatory interest regarding retirement investing and fiduciary initiatives, as well as environmental, social and governance (“ESG) consideration and responsible investing; cybersecurity and resilience; the use of artificial intelligence; responsible information and data collection, storage and use; financial crime prevention; and privacy matters . We expect this to continue at the federal and state level .
 Certain of our subsidiaries are registered with the  U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission as broker-dealers under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 . The SEC and FINRA have stringent rules with respect to the net capital requirements . Our financial advisors are representatives of a dual registrant, meaning it is registered both as an investment adviser and an investment advisor .
 The SEC’s Regulation Best Interest standard of care became effective June 30, 2020 . The DOL finalized its voluntary exemption for providing investment advice to retirement account clients . Several states have either issued their own best interest or fiduciary rules or are considering doing so . While not a regulator, the Certified Financial Planner Board professional standards of co-advisers .
 Certain of our asset management subsidiaries are registered as investment advisers under the Advisers Act and are subject to regulation by the SEC . Other agencies, exchanges and self-regulatory organizations of which certain of our broker-dealer subsidiaries are members include the Commodities Futures Trading Commission (“CFTC”) and the National Futures Association .
 Certain of our asset management subsidiaries are registered with the CFTC as a commodity trading advisor and commodity pool operator . Columbia Threadneedle is authorized to conduct its financial services business in the U.K. outside the Financial Services and Markets Act 2000 . The SEC’s best interest standards, state and other fiduciary or best interest rules, as well as other similar standards would be relevant to our global asset management business .
 Key U.K. regulatory developments and trends include the following: Operational Resilience, diversity, Equity and Inclusion . The FCA recently introduced a new Consumer Duty that sets higher expectations for the standard of care that firms provide to retail consumers . Firms are also required to stress test their important business services and appoint a senior manager accountable .
 Certain of our asset management subsidiaries and branches are required to comply with pan-European directives . These directives have impacted and will continue to impact our global asset management business . We continue to see enhanced legislative and regulatory interest regarding financial services through international markets, including in the U.K. and EU where we have a substantial asset manage business .
 These international rules, proposed rules, regulatory priorities or general discussions may impact us directly or indirectly, including as a regulated entity or as a service provider to, or a business receiving services from or engaging in transactions with, regulated entities . In addition to regulations noted in this section, within the EU and the U.K. we have been and will continue to address regulatory reforms or structural changes .
 ATC is primarily regulated by the MN DOC (Banking Division) and is subject to capital adequacy requirements under Minnesota law . It is prohibited from accepting deposits or making personal or commercial loans . ATC, as well as our investment adviser subsidiaries, may be subject to ERISA, and the regulations thereunder, insofar as they act as a ‘fiduciary” under ERISA with respect to certain ERISA clients .
 Aspects of the regulation applicable to our Advice & Wealth Management segment also apply to our Retirement & Protection Solutions segment and the closed blocks in our Corporate & Other segment . Financial regulation of our RiverSource Life companies is extensive, and their financial transactions (such as intercompany dividends and investment activity) may be subject to pre-approval and/or continuing evaluation by the Domiciliary Regulators .
 Certain variable annuity and variable life insurance contracts are registered as securities under the Securities Act of 1933 and as investment companies under the Investment Company Act of 1940, as amended . The Federal Insurance Office (“FIO”) within the U.S. Department of Treasury does not have substantive regulatory responsibilities, though it is tasked with monitoring the insurance industry .
 RiverSource Life companies would be subject to various levels of regulatory intervention if their total adjusted statutory capital falls below defined RBC action levels . At the “company action level” defined as total adjusted capital level between 100% and 75% of the RBC requirement, an insurer must submit a plan for corrective action with its primary state regulator . RBC report is completed as of December 31 and filed annually, along with statutory financial statements .
 The ORSA Model Act requires that an insurer create and file, annually, its ORSA, which is a complete self-assessment of its risk management functions and capital adequacy . As a federally chartered savings bank, Ameriprise Bank is subject to numerous rules and regulations governing all aspects of the banking business .
 Ameriprise Financial is a savings and loan holding company that is subject to regulation, supervision, and examination by the FRB . The OCC would be required to take remedial actions and could take other actions, including imposing further limits on dividends or business activities . Community Reinvestment Act (“CRA”), fair lending and other consumer protection laws and regulations apply .
 Ameriprise Bank must remain “well-capitalized” and ‘well-managed” under applicable regulations . The Volcker Rule prohibits “banking entities,” including Ameriprises, from engaging in certain “proprietary trading” activities . Failure to meet one or more of these requirements would mean, depending on the violation and any agreement then reached with the FRB, Ameriprisps could not undertake new activities .
 Ameriprise Financial, Inc. is subject to a 250% minimum, effective January 1, 2024 . The ratio of the amount of available capital to the capital requirement amount is referred to as the BBA ratio . An additional capital conservation buffer of 150% will be effective as of December 31, 2025, for a total capital requirement of at least 400%.
 Many aspects of our business are subject to comprehensive legal requirements concerning the use and protection of personal information . This includes rules adopted pursuant to the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, the Fair and Accurate Credit Transactions Act and the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act . We assess the impact of, and monitor our status under, the EU Financial Conglomerates Directive .
 The USA Patriot Act was enacted in October 2001 . We are subject to federal, state, local and foreign environmental laws and regulations . We have developed and implemented a cybersecurity incident response manual . We will continue to comply with anti-money laundering legislation in the U.K. derived from applicable EU directives and international initiatives adopted in other jurisdictions in which we conduct business .
 Investors and others interested in the Company are encouraged to visit the Investor Relations website from time to time . Users can sign up to receive automatic notifications when new materials are posted . The information found on the website is not incorporated by reference into this report or in any other report or document we furnish or file with the SEC .
